body.p: Based on the results of a nationwide study, the number of contacts programmed into cell phones are summarized on the following boxplot:
Which interval contains the greatest amount of data?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The only data in this interval is between 25 and 50, and since these represent the minimum and Q1, we expect to find 25% of the data in this interval. Another interval contains more data.

Correct. This interval stretches from Q1 to well above the median, so we can be sure that it contains more than 25% of the data. No other interval has more than 25% of the data, so this is the best answer.
Incorrect. The data in this interval is between the median and Q3, so we expect to find 25% of the data in this interval. Another interval contains more data.

Incorrect. The data in this interval starts at Q3 but does not make it all the way to the maximum, so we would expect to find less than 25% of the data in this interval. Another interval contains more data.

Incorrect. For each interval we are able to establish if it contains 25% of the data, more than 25% or less than 25% of the data. Since only one interval contains more than 25% of the data, we are able to determine which interval has the greatest amount of data.

body.p: Based on the results of a nationwide study, the number of contacts programmed into cell phones are summarized on the following boxplot:
Which interval contains the greatest amount of data?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The only data in this interval is between 25 and 50, and since these represent the minimum and Q1, we expect to find 25% of the data in this interval. Another interval contains more data.

Correct. This interval stretches from Q1 to well above the median, so we can be sure that it contains more than 25% of the data. No other interval has more than 25% of the data, so this is the best answer.
Incorrect. This interval stretches from less than Q3 to more than Q3, so we can not be sure how much data is in this interval except that it must be less than 50%.

Incorrect. The data in this interval starts at Q3 but does not make it all the way to the maximum, so we would expect to find less than 25% of the data in this interval. Another interval contains more data.

Incorrect. For each interval we are able to establish if it contains 25% of the data, more than 25% or less than 25% of the data. Since only one interval contains more than 25% of the data, we are able to determine which interval has the greatest amount of data.
